revised_title: Fossil Flora of Bovey Tracey: A Miocene Discovery
tldr: The author examines the fossilized flora found in the lignite beds of Bovey Tracey and identifies them as belonging to the Miocene period. The discovery includes various species of plants, such as Cinnamomum, Pecopteris, and Sequoia, which are characteristic of the Miocene era. The author also discusses the possible environment and formation of the lignite beds, suggesting that the Bovey basin was once occupied by an inland lake.
